  physical_appearance: This gelatin silver print captures the scene of a dockyard where a row of boats were secured in place by looping ropes into poles that have been stuck vertically into the shore.  The print itself shows discolouring along its edges
 and the white backing it was mounted on has brown spotting.

  sgcool_label_text: Ho Koon Sang was a member of the Photographic Society of Singapore and an Associate of the Royal Photographic Society in London. This photograph was part of a set of 12 prints sent to the Royal Photographic Society in 1956.
